intro: Dalea formosa, commonly known as the pink prairie clover, is a flowering plant native to the central and northern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of pink to red flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands. Dalea formosa plays an important role in supporting pollinators and is valued for its ecological and ornamental qualities.
